column4: OK I am having a serious problem UBUNTU will not boot, it boots directly into a grub shell, im running Ubuntu 10 I installed with WIBI, how can I get it to boot a kernel!
I am stuck in a grub shell and I have no idea what to do =/
yeah. got it. does it tell you anything?
I've never had to handle grub> but lets see.
I don't know, though lets read on that link..
are you in front of your grub shell now?
if so. you could try out ls /
linux -command with a kernel file loads the kernel. that might help for now.
what does the ls / give you?
never been in that mode myself so I guess not able to help you. You have to wait but it seems this channel has quite quiet tone here.
It feels silly a linux installation gets 'fixed' by itself. but seems it happens then.
I'd look up whats wrong. look up into /var/log
